text:
Aors emt

LEE, Suk-Hee
CTR 4317

DNA Replication is inhibited via a novel mechanism upon UV-damage
Rachid Drissi and Suk-Hee Lee*

Department of Virology and Molecular Biology, St. Jude Children's Research
Hospital, Memphis, Tennessee 38105, USA.

Key words: Coupled repair-replication, simian virus 40, DNA damage, nucleotide excision

repair

* To whom correspondence should be addressed at the Department of Virology and Molecular
Biology, St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, Memphis, Tennessee 38101-0318, USA. Tel:
(901) 495-2519 FAX: (901) 523-2622

Abbreviations: $V40, simian virus 40; T antigen, large tumor antigen; UV, ultraviolet ray; Al,
activator 1; RF-C, replication factor C; pol a: and pol 8, DNA polymerase 0: and 8 respectively;
PCNA, proliferating cell nuclear antigen; NER, nucleotide excision repair; RPA, replication

5 DTT, dithiothreitol.

 

 

50688901
